1660.verse: قَالَ|He said,|73|80|309$هَلْ|"Should|69|83|1829$ءَامَنُكُمْ|I entrust you|107|121|9121$عَلَيْهِ|with him|75|89|395$إِلَّا|except|65|79|86$كَمَآ|as|53|67|110$أَمِنتُكُمْ|I entrusted you|123|137|9122$عَلَىٰٓ|with|63|70|52$أَخِيهِ|his brother|91|113|4909$مِن قَبْلُ‌ۖ|before?|92|135|250$فَٱللَّهُ|But Allah|78|121|1054$خَيْرٌ|(is) the best|103|146|520$حَـٰفِظًا‌ۖ|Guardian|78|121|9123$وَهُوَ|and He|66|88|305$أَرْحَمُ|(is the) Most Merciful|162|350|6873$ٱلرَّٲحِمِينَ|(of) the merciful."|138|326|6874$

1661.verse: وَلَمَّا|And when|85|97|852$فَتَحُواْ|they opened|103|126|9124$مَتَـٰعَهُمْ|their baggage,|116|139|9125$وَجَدُواْ|they found|92|115|9126$بِضَـٰعَتَهُمْ|their merchandise|137|160|9110$رُدَّتْ|returned|76|88|9127$إِلَيْهِمْ‌ۖ|to them.|77|95|3030$قَالُواْ|They said,|89|125|101$يَـٰٓأَبَانَا|"O our father!|111|147|8840$مَا|What|55|91|262$نَبْغِى‌ۖ|(could) we desire?|142|178|9128$هَـٰذِهِۦ|This|73|91|374$بِضَـٰعَتُنَا|(is) our merchandise|155|171|9129$رُدَّتْ|returned|76|108|9127$إِلَيْنَا‌ۖ|to us.|59|91|1234$وَنَمِيرُ|And we will get provision|184|216|9130$أَهْلَنَا|(for) our family,|124|140|9131$وَنَحْفَظُ|and we will protect|147|159|9132$أَخَانَا|our brother|94|118|9118$وَنَزْدَادُ|and get an increase|152|176|9133$كَيْلَ|measure|75|99|9103$بَعِيرٍ‌ۖ|(of) a camel's (load).|160|172|9134$ذَٲلِكَ|That|64|162|28$كَيْلٌ|(is) a measurement|148|345|9135$يَسِيرٌ|easy."|69|168|9136$

1662.verse: قَالَ|He said,|73|79|309$لَنْ|"Never|63|75|524$أُرْسِلَهُۥ|will I send him|113|125|9137$مَعَكُمْ|with you|77|89|121$حَتَّىٰ|until|64|76|526$تُؤْتُونِ|you give to me|119|131|9138$مَوْثِقًا|a promise|83|95|9139$مِّنَ|by|50|56|156$ٱللَّهِ|Allah|53|60|606$لَتَأْتُنَّنِى بِهِۦٓ|that surely you will bring him to me|253|266|9140$إِلَّآ|unless|61|74|86$أَن|that|48|61|655$يُحَاطَ بِكُمْ‌ۖ|you are surrounded."|158|171|9141$فَلَمَّآ|And when|85|92|141$ءَاتَوْهُ|they had given him|146|159|9142$مَوْثِقَهُمْ|their promise,|110|136|9143$قَالَ|he said,|72|98|309$ٱللَّهُ|"Allah|56|82|123$عَلَىٰ|over|63|89|52$مَا|what|53|79|262$نَقُولُ|we say|67|80|5491$وَكِيلٌ|(is) a Guardian."|127|127|5907$

1660.verse: He said, "Should I entrust you with him except [under coercion] as I entrusted you with his brother before? But Allah is the best guardian, and He is the most merciful of the merciful."

1661.verse: And when they opened their baggage, they found their merchandise returned to them. They said, "O our father, what [more] could we desire? This is our merchandise returned to us. And we will obtain supplies for our family and protect our brother and obtain an increase of a camel's load; that is an easy measurement."

1662.verse: [Jacob] said, "Never will I send him with you until you give me a promise by Allah that you will bring him [back] to me, unless you should be surrounded by enemies." And when they had given their promise, he said, "Allah, over what we say, is Witness."

1663.verse: And he said, "O my sons, do not enter from one gate but enter from different gates; and I cannot avail you against [the decree of] Allah at all. The decision is only for Allah; upon Him I have relied, and upon Him let those who would rely [indeed] rely."

1664.verse: And when they entered from where their father had ordered them, it did not avail them against Allah at all except [it was] a need within the soul of Jacob, which he satisfied. And indeed, he was a possessor of knowledge because of what We had taught him, but most of the people do not know.

1665.verse: And when they entered upon Joseph, he took his brother to himself; he said, "Indeed, I am your brother, so do not despair over what they used to do [to me]."
